required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Accuracy of LASIK Flaps Created With the LenSx® Femtosecond Laser - A Pilot Study
clinical_study.official_title: Accuracy of LASIK Flaps Created With the LenSx® Femtosecond Laser - A Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the thickness accuracy of Laser-assisted in situ keratomileusis (LASIK) flaps created with the LenSx® Laser.

primary_outcome.measure: Flap Thickness Accuracy Within the Central Zone at Month 3 Postoperative
primary_outcome.description: Flap thickness was assessed by optical coherence tomography (OCT) and averaged from 3 separate scans. Flap thickness accuracy was defined as the mean difference between the achieved and desired (desired subtracted from achieved) flap thickness. A positive number represents a postoperative flap thickness that is thicker than the expected flap thickness and vice versa for a negative number. Each eye contributed separately to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Flap Thickness Accuracy Within the Central Zone at Month 1 Postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: Flap thickness was assessed by OCT and averaged from 3 separate scans. Flap thickness accuracy was defined as the mean difference between the achieved and desired (desired subtracted from achieved) flap thickness. A positive number represents a postoperative flap thickness that is thicker than the expected flap thickness and vice versa for a negative number. Each eye contributed separately to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Flap Thickness Precision Within the Central Zone at Month 1 and Month 3 Postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: Flap thickness was assessed by OCT and averaged from 3 separate scans. Flap thickness precision (variability of the achieved flap thickness) was defined as the standard deviation of the flap thickness measurement. Each eye contributed separately to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ease of Flap Dissection at Day 0, Operative Day
secondary_outcome.description: Ease of flap dissection (ease of lifting the flap during surgery) was assessed on a scale from 0 to 5 where 0 = Unable to lift flap and 5 = Able to lift flap without any resistance using blunt instrument. Each eye contributed separately to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Stromal Bed Quality at Day 0, Operative Day
secondary_outcome.description: Stromal bed quality was assessed by the investigator on a roughness scale from 0 to 5 where 0 = Very rough surface and 5 = Very smooth surface. Each eye contributed separately to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Opaque Bubble Layer (OBL) at Day 0, Operative Day
secondary_outcome.description: Opaque bubble layer was assessed by the investigator during the surgery on a scale from 0 to 5 where 0 = No OBL and 5 = 100% OBL in the stromal bed area. Each eye contributed separately to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Uncorrected Distance Visual Acuity (UCDVA) at Month 1 and Month 3 Postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: UCDVA (measurement of uncorrected (without spectacles or other visual corrective devices) distance visual acuity) was assessed at a distance of 6 meters or 20 feet using a standard Snellen eye chart, both monocularly and binocularly, and reported categorically as a percentage of eyes analyzed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Best Corrected Distance Visual Acuity (BCDVA) by Visit
secondary_outcome.description: BCDVA (measurement with the participant's best spectacle correction) was assessed at a distance of 6 meters or 20 feet using a standard Snellen eye chart, both monocularly and binocularly, and reported categorically as a percentage of eyes analyzed.
The participant was manually refracted to his/her best correction using a phoropter and standard Snellen eye charts. Each eye contributed separately to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Prediction Error Between Target Versus Achieved Refraction at One and Three Months Post-op
secondary_outcome.description: Prediction error was summarized as a percentage of eyes within 0.5 D and 1.0 D of target at one and three months postoperative

arm_group.description: LASIK surgery in both eyes using LenSx® Femtosecond Laser System

intervention.description: Used for the creation of a corneal flap in patients undergoing LASIK surgery

facility.name: Contact Alcon Call Center for Trial Locations

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited from 2 sites located in the US.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 34 enrolled, 4 participants were exited as screen failures prior to surgery. This reporting group includes all treated participants (30).

group.title: LenSx
group.description: LASIK surgery in both eyes using LenSx® Femtosecond Laser System

baseline.population: This analysis population includes all participants/eyes exposed to the device during the study (Safety Analysis Set).

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AEs) were collected from time of consent for the duration of participation in the study (up to 5 months). AEs are reported as pre-treatment and treatment-emergent. “At Risk" population for ocular AEs is included with unit of “eyes."
reported_events.desc: An AE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence, unintended disease or injury, or untoward clinical signs in subjects, users or other persons, whether or not related to the medical device.

group.title: Pre-treatment
group.description: All who consented to participate in the study prior to the initiation of study treatment

group.title: LenSx
group.description: All subjects treated with LASIK surgery in both eyes using LenSx® Femtosecond Laser System

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor reserves the right of prior review of any publication or presentation of information related to the study.
